column4: I'd like to set up my own apt-get repository.  It would only have custom builds of a few packages.  My searches have only yielded information on setting up mirrors.  Can someone point me to a guide or am I asking for nonsense?
you don't want to create a PPA?
I don't know.  I want it to be private and local.
http://wiki.debian.org/HowToSetupADebianRepository
install actual vim, you will have alternative automatically...
Dr_Willis: Real vim is installed, it is not a choice when I do "update-alternative --config editor"
you want to update the vim alternative
Sorry, I don't know how to do that.  It doesn't seem to be "update-alternative --config vim"
it is
I mistyped it.  Now I get "There is only one alternative in link group vim: /usr/bin/vim.basic"
but editor should also list the vim variants.  How did you install real vim?
apt-get install vim -> "vim is already the newest version"
try vim-gtk or vim-gnome
This is a headless machine.
vim-nox then
are you using ubuntu?
you enabled the root account yourself?  What further modifications did you make to sshd_config?  To your system?
I did not enable the root login myself as far as I'm aware.  Actually, let me check, that may have been changed automatically as part of a setup script.
the root account is disabled by default on ubuntu.  How did you install this system?

It looks like part of the post-install script is to copy an sshd_config over the existing one.  If I diff the current copy to the backup of the original it says the only line changed is UseDNS no .  So I doubt my 'backup' copy is clean.
that's impossible since root login isn't allowed by default either
Yes.  That's my point.
can you pastebin the current sshd_config?
I don't think so
